habitat: Mixed woodlands and grassy meadows near beech, chestnut, pine, spruce, fir, summer to autumn, Europe and eastern Asia, acidic soils.
shortDescription: Deadly poisonous white mushroom with egg-shaped to bell-shaped cap, white gills, slender stem with hanging ring and volva, contains alpha-amanitin causing liver failure.
benefitsOrToxicity: Alpha-amanitin causes vomiting, diarrhea, liver failure 6-24 hours after ingestion, can lead to death.

identification.cap: 2.5-12 cm, oval to convex or bell-shaped, smooth dry to sticky, white to ivory, yellow or pinkish with age.
identification.gills: White to cream, close, flocculose edge, short gills truncated.
identification.stem: 5-12 cm tall, 0.8-1.5 cm diameter, cylindrical white, solid or pithy-hollow, concentric scaly rings below ring, white to yellowish ring, volva at base.
identification.flesh: Fragile white, unpleasant taste like radish or raw potato.
identification.taste: Unpleasant, like radish or raw potato.
identification.odor: None young, sickly sweet or rotting meat aged.

note: Deadly, mistaken for edible, debate on species in North America.
